brotherData.name: Aryaman Ghosh
brotherData.title: Regent
brotherData.description: Aryaman Ghosh is a current junior majoring in Computer Science. Aryaman, or Ary for short, is an international student from India. He joined Theta Tau during Fall of 2022, and has made his mark from there. Holding the position of Media Co-Head, he has helped bring the Fraternity’s social media to a new level. Currently, he works for the University as an ITCS Student Assistant. He has always traveled ever since he was little, visiting numerous countries and living in many different places. This has caused him to grow up in multiple different environments, leading to his success both as a student and a leader.

brotherData.name: Gabriel Thornton
brotherData.title: Vice Regent
brotherData.description: Gabe, a passionate and dedicated mechanical engineering student hailing from Orchard Park, NY, has a number of impressive accomplishments under his belt. Notably, he was the recipient of the Design Award for EAS 199. In addition to his academic achievements, Gabe is an accomplished leader within the university and Theta Tau community. He served as the Fundraising Vice Head and Head of the Brotherhood, where he displayed excellent communication skills and the ability to motivate his peers. Looking to the future, Gabe has his sights set on the automotive or renewable power industries and plans to work in Buffalo upon graduation. But there’s more to Gabe than just his professional goals. He has a passion for seltzer water and maintains a well-equipped home gym. In his free time, Gabe can be found watching the Buffalo Sabres, hanging out with friends, and giving back to the community by volunteering with Hearts for the Homeless in downtown Buffalo.

brotherData.name: Marissa Gabbamonte
brotherData.title: Cor. Secretary
brotherData.description: Marissa Gabbamonte is a Biomedical Engineering student hailing from Long Island, NY. Her outstanding achievements include earning the NY State Biliteracy Seal in Italian and induction into the Gamma Kappa Alpha Italian Honor Society. She has taken on several leadership roles within the Mu Gamma chapter of Theta Tau, including serving as the Corresponding Secretary for 2023, Head of BOC in Fall 2022, and as the APM for Chi Beta pledging class. After college, Marissa plans to enter the workforce and use her biomedical engineering knowledge to create innovative devices. In her free time, she indulges in hobbies such as baking, painting, and crafting, while also enjoying a diverse range of music genres such as punk rock, country, classic rock, pop, and musicals. She is also an avid sports fan, particularly of football and baseball.

brotherData.name: Yuanjie Xu
brotherData.title: Treasurer
brotherData.description: Yuanjie Xu is a current Junior in Computer Science. He joined the Fraternity in Spring of 2022 with the Phi Beta class. Within the Fraternity, he served as the Head of Construction and is currently the Fraternity’s Treasurer, where he plays an extremely important role in the dues and funding of Fraternity activities. Yuanjie is a hard working individual who always lends a hand to his fellow Brothers in need. Along with this, during Summer of 2021, he was a Data Entry Intern for Kumon where he entered classwork and homework data efficiently allowing ease of access for tutors along with assisting multiple students in order to enhance their problem-solving skills.

brotherData.name: Karen Cheng
brotherData.title: Scribe
brotherData.description: temp

brotherData.name: Daniel Klein
brotherData.title: Pledge Marshal
brotherData.description: Daniel Klein, a current Junior studying Mechanical Engineering, joined Theta Tau during Spring of 2022 with the Phi Beta class. He is from Olean, NY which is approximately 1.5 hours south from Buffalo. Upon joining Theta Tau, he served as the Vice Regent for two semesters now and has had an immense impact on the development of the Fraternity and managing the multiple committees. Outside of Theta Tau, Daniel highly enjoys playing basketball and has visited New York City before.

brotherData.name: Lior Adjudanpor
brotherData.description: Lior Adjudanpor is a junior majoring in Electrical Engineering and proudly a first-generation college student. Hailing from Long Island, Lior embodies a spirited dedication to academic pursuits alongside a profound passion for soccer. Beyond the lecture halls, Lior revels in the intricate world of engineering while finding pure joy on the soccer field. The blend of technological curiosity and a fervor for sports fuels Lior's drive to excel both academically and athletically.

brotherData.name: Matt Amato
brotherData.description: Matthew Amato is a driven Junior studying Biomedical Engineering at the University at Buffalo Honors College, seeking to expand his knowledge and gain practical experience in the field. With a strong passion for cell culture and tissue engineering, he is actively seeking an internship opportunity during the summer of 2023 to further develop his skills and knowledge. Matthew thrives in a laboratory environment, where he can don his coat and gloves to observe cells through a microscope. In addition to his academic pursuits, Matthew works as a Front End Assistant at Costco Wholesale, where he has honed his interpersonal and communication skills. He has achieved one of the highest member upgrades at his location, a testament to his ability to problem-solve and work collaboratively as part of a team. With his dedication to his studies and his valuable skill set, Matthew is poised to excel in his future endeavors.

brotherData.name: William Bizier
brotherData.description: temp

brotherData.name: Lydia Cenac
brotherData.description: Lydia Cenac is a current Freshman majoring in Computer Science with a Music minor. She crossed into the Fraternity during the Fall of 2022 with the Chi Beta class and was born and raised in Brooklyn, NY. During the Summer of 2021, she was a UI/UX Designer for Content Economy Co. Additionally, she participated in America on Tech where she was a member of the Tech Flex Leaders and the UX Design Bootcamp. Her extensive achievements have proven her a valuable asset to the Fraternity. In her free time, she actively plays the Viola and is currently in the school’s Orchestra. Lydia is an all rounder, excelling in both her STEM courses and musical talents.

brotherData.name: Elise Dougherty
brotherData.description: Elise Dougherty is a current Junior majoring in Chemical Engineering. Since crossing during the spring of 2021 with the Tau Beta class, Elise has been actively progressing and supporting this fraternity and its three pillars. She currently serves as the Regent for Theta Tau Mu Gamma Chapter, and she also had an older sister who was a Brother of Theta Tau. Originally from Syracuse, Elise indulges in multiple hobbies. Her pastimes include ice skating, rollerblading, and binging TV shows. She is also a huge fan of Taylor Swift!

brotherData.name: Daniel Galdamez
brotherData.description: Daniel Galdamez is a current Junior in Environmental Engineering and a member of the Honors College. He is from Long Island, specifically Suffolk Country. Daniel joined Theta Tau during Spring of 2022 with the Phi Beta class. Upon joining this Fraternity, he has shown extreme dedication and involvement, currently holding the positions of Head for the Construction Committee for two semesters and being an Assistant Pledge Marshal for the Spring 2023 Psi Beta class. Outside of his immense Fraternity involvement, his involvement in helping out the community does not stop. He currently tutors students in South Campus in the Science and Technology Entry Program (STEP) program where he assists students in the Buffalo area enter the STEM field and provide academic assistance. He is also a First-Generation student and is a current First-Generation Peer Mentor, where he assists incoming First-Generation students adjust to college.

brotherData.name: Abel Itty George
brotherData.description: temp

brotherData.name: Max Gustin
brotherData.description: Max Gustin is a current Junior in Electrical Engineering. He joined Theta Tau during the spring of 2021 with the Tau Beta class. Max is extremely hard working and values getting involved in university, currently being in the Thunder of the East Marching Band and the National Society of Professional Engineers. However, this is not where his achievements stop. During the summer of 2022, he was an Electrical Engineering Intern for Moog Inc. Currently, Max is a Student Leader for the Freshman Engineering Course, where he mentors freshman students to assist them in adjusting to college. In his free time, Max enjoys listening to classic rock, especially the Beatles. He is also a fan of the Packers football team, the number 12 being one of his favorite numbers because of Aaron Rogers, the quarterback of said football team. He also loves his two dogs from back home, Jeanette and Tobey; A black lab and cockapoo respectively.

brotherData.name: James Henry
brotherData.description: James Henry is a dedicated Chemical Engineering student from Lakeview, NY. He has maintained his position in the Honors College throughout his time at UB and has gained valuable leadership experience as a manager at a local ice cream shop. James plans to pursue a Master's in Engineering after graduation and is excited to continue his academic and professional journey. In his free time, James is an avid gamer and enjoys playing on his PC. He is also a member of the UB rugby team and loves spending time with his friends and roommates. Despite his busy schedule, James still finds time to enjoy his favorite fast food chain, McDonald's, and has even eaten there nearly every day during one summer. James's friendly demeanor, dedication, and hard work make him a valuable member of the UB community and a promising young engineer.

brotherData.name: Bushra Khan
brotherData.description: Bushra Khan is a computer science student studying at the University at Buffalo. She is focusing on front end development and UI/UX design. She's worked as an IT consultant, computer science instructor, math teacher, and has interned at Deutsche Bank during the summer of 2023. She enjoys working with visual elements on applications and websites as it allows a sense of creative freedom with what she creates. She also enjoys indulging in many creative feats including music, singing, poetry, and creative writing.

brotherData.name: Anna Kane
brotherData.description: Anna Kane is a driven Mechanical Engineering major from Kings Park, New York. She is a recipient of both the New York State Pride Scholarship and the Women’s Empowerment Scholarship, which attest to her academic and leadership excellence. Anna has demonstrated her commitment to leadership through her role as Co-Head of Fundraising in the Spring of 2022. Her efforts in this role were instrumental in ensuring the success of fundraising initiatives. Her experience in this position showcases her leadership, teamwork, and communication skills. After graduation, Anna plans to enter the workforce and apply her skills and knowledge to real-world engineering challenges. As a dual citizen of the US and Ireland, she is interested in learning more about her Irish heritage and exploring different cultures. Anna also enjoys cooking, going to the beach, and attending concerts.

brotherData.name: Lana Kim
brotherData.description: My name is Lana Kim and I am a Junior studying Computer Science in the Honors College. I crossed Theta Tau in Spring of 2023 (Psi Beta), but am also in another organization on campus called Alpha Phi Omega crossing Fall 2021 (Beta Pi). Within Theta Tau, I am the current Co-Head for Media Committee, where we were able to see the Fraternity instagram (@ubthetatau) grow 16.5% since coming into this position. I am also an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant for CSE 115 and a Resident Advisor for the Governors Complex. For the past two summers, I've worked as a Teaching Assistant for the Girls Who Code Summer Immersion Program (SIP), which is a 2 week bootcamp-type program (3 rounds occurring throughout the whole summer) targeting females and non-binary high schoolers to encourage them to pursue Computer Science and ultimately close the gender gap. Other than academics, I enjoy social media and marketing, being the past Samsung College Brand Ambassador and Amazon Prime College Brand Ambassador.

brotherData.name: Jeffrey Kou
brotherData.description: Jeffrey Kou is a current Junior studying Mechanical Engineering. He joined the Fraternity during Spring of 2022 with the Phi Beta class. Within school, he is heavily involved in the Society of Asian Scientist and Engineers (SASE). He is currently a member of the Design Committee, where he assists in creating material and graphics for the Fraternity. Over the summer, he will be an intern in his field of study. Jefrrey is also originally from Queens, NY and attended Aviation Career and TechnicaI Education High School studying Aeronautircs/Aviation/Aerospace Science and Technology. In his free time, he enjoys playing volleyball and basketball, being extremely athletic. He is also half Mandarin and half Cantonese.

brotherData.name: Edward Masalimov
brotherData.description: Edward Masalimov, originally from Brooklyn, NY, is pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering. He has been actively involved in the Theta Tau fraternity, serving as Head of Professional Development, Head of Bylaws, and Head of Fundraising. Through these positions, he has demonstrated strong leadership skills and a dedication to the success of the organization. Aside from his passion for engineering, Edward is an avid fan of water parks and has visited numerous ones. He enjoys the rush of adrenaline and the joy of cooling off on a hot day. Edward's fun-loving personality and commitment to his goals make him a valuable member of the Theta Tau community.

brotherData.name: Muhtasim Mushfiq
brotherData.title: Sadeed's Big
brotherData.description: Muhtasim Mushfiq, a 200lb cracked CS Senior, can rep 2 plates easily on bench and likes Ironman and Spiderman. He also has a very cool pledge named Sadeed as his little.

brotherData.name: Isabella Nguyen
brotherData.description: Isabella Nguyen is currently a Sophomore majoring in Electrical Engineering. She was born and raised in Buffalo, NY and joined this Fraternity during Fall of 2022 in the Chi Beta class. Isabella, who goes by Bella with her close friends, is a hard working individual who always strives to be the best version she can. Within the Fraternity, she has had an immense impact by being the Media Co-Head and running the @ubthetatau instagram, assisting in boosting their graphics and social media activeness. Outside of the Fraternity, she is currently involved in Vietnamese Student Association and plays an active part in their activities.

brotherData.name: Carlos Pedraza
brotherData.title: W Big
brotherData.description: Carlos Pedraza is an electrical engineering student with a profound interest in 3D printers and 3D printing. Alongside pursuing his degree, Carlos holds a job at a custom control electrical panel shop, showcasing his practical application of electrical engineering skills. Additionally, he proudly serves as a member of the US Army Reserves, displaying his dedication to both academic pursuits and military service.

brotherData.name: Quentin Rotoli
brotherData.description: temp

brotherData.name: Adrian Sin
brotherData.description: Adrian Sin, originally from Brooklyn, NY is a current Sophomore studying Computer Science. Crossing in the Phi Beta class during Spring of 2022. Within the Fraternity, Adrian is a member of the Design Committee. During his first semester of his Freshman Year, he placed 3rd in the UB Hackathon for M&T bank challenge. In his free time, he enjoys being active, playing basketball with his fellow Pledge Brothers and friends.

brotherData.name: Rrucha Singh
brotherData.description: Rrucha Singh is a driven individual originally from India who is currently pursuing her studies at the University at Buffalo. She is an active member of the university community, serving as an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant, a UBIT Tech Squad Consultant, and a Senior Research Aide at the Research Foundation for SUNY. As an Undergraduate Teaching Assistant, Rrucha shares her knowledge and passion for algorithmic concepts, such as graph theory, dynamic programming, and NP-completeness, with her students. She takes pride in evaluating each student's comprehension level and providing tailored feedback accordingly. Rrucha's strong work ethic and dedication to her studies and work make her a valuable asset to the University at Buffalo  and the Theta Tau community.

brotherData.name: Justin Siwa
brotherData.description: Justin Siwa is a current junior undergraduate student studying Environmental Engineering. He joined Theta Tau in the spring of 2022 along with his pledge class Phi Beta. Born and raised in Buffalo, Justin enjoys spending his free time fishing, rock climbing, and weightlifting.

brotherData.name: Chloe Tullius
brotherData.description: Chloe Tullius is a biomedical engineering student, from Amherst, NY. Her passion for biomedical engineering began in high school when she worked for Western New York Stem Hub as a student leader and as a co-teacher for the Hand in Hand Project and Prism Project. The Hand in Hand Project allowed for middle school and high school students to create 3D printed movable hands for children born without. During the Prism project she taught high functioning autistic children multiple STEM activities. For her work with the Stem hub she was awarded the International Girls Living In STEM Award in 2019. In Chloe’s free time she enjoys to go ice skating and spend time with friends. After graduation she plans to continue school to receive her masters degree in biomedical engineering. She plans to focus on prosthetics engineering and to make a difference in the community around her.

brotherData.name: Michael VanAuken
brotherData.description: Michael vanauken is a junior studying electrical engineering and he joined Theta Tau in the spring of 2023. He is from Syracuse and despises the snow. Outside of the fraternity he enjoys watching football(especially sports betting) and going out with friends.

brotherData.name: Mathew Yeung
brotherData.description: Mathew Yeung is a computer science major and a proud Tesla Driver.

brotherData.name: Jenny Zhu
brotherData.description: Jenny Zhu is a Sophomore majoring in Electrical Engineering from Staten Island, New York. She joined Theta Tau during Fall of 2022 with the Chi Beta class. Upon entering the Fraternity, she has shown immense effort and passion towards mentoring the incoming class and makes herself an active member of the Brotherhood. Jenny started her undergraduate career at The City College of New York as an Architecture major. She has also played the trombone for the past 9 years. Upon transferring to the University at Buffalo, she currently is employed as a Student Assistant in the Sophomore building Greiner Hall.

brotherData.name: Hao Zhu
brotherData.description: Hao Zhu is a dedicated and ambitious Sophomore majoring in Computer Science from Staten Island, New York but born in Brooklyn. He has shown an exceptional commitment to leadership within Theta Tau, currently serving as the Scribe and Co-Head of Design, demonstrating his exceptional ability to work well in a team and help coordinate successful projects. Aside from his academic and professional endeavors, Hao has a unique and interesting personality. He sports a scar on his forehead from falling down the stairs when he was younger, which makes for an interesting conversation starter. When he's not busy with his studies or leadership roles, he enjoys camping with his friends from New York City. His passion for adventure and the great outdoors is evident in his love for camping and exploring new places.
